nodes.bodyText:
will --> with ?
No translation ?
it is not recommended to leave commented lines of code (especially not without any further explanation as to why). Better to remove it.
Important : it is necessary to handle the case where the optional doesn't have a value. is there really no possible case of figure where there is not a single billOfMaterial with versionNumber == 1 ?

Doc comments should not be positioned inside a method or constructor definition block.
Use regular block comments :
/*
*
*/

There should be a config in app base indicating the number of digits for quantity fields throughout the app.
Maybe it should be used here instead ?
The comment thing again.
The comment thing again.

ManufOrderWorkflowService is injecting itself in one of its methods ?
Generally speaking, there are a lot of Beans.get in this big method. Make sure to check if some of them should not be @Inject-ed instead. Either for performance or to handle possible circular dependencies.

ManufOrderRepository is already injected in the constructor. No need to use Beans.get.
Also, the msitake had already been made at other places in this file (at the very least, a few lines above this one), might as well fix them since we're at it.
It's already injected in the constructor.
It's already injected in the constructor
probably not an issue here, but it's generally better to do (ManufOrderRepository.STATUS_DRAFT).equals(x.getStatusSelect()) to avoid potential NPEs
Error messages should be defined in static variables in a separate interface.
Error messages should be defined in static variables in a separate interface.
"fusionner ces ordres"... de fabrication ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,8 +19,10 @@
 "App production",,,
 "Applicable",,,
 "Approval","Homologation",,
+"Are you sur you want to merge those manuf orders?"," Etes-vous certain de vouloir fusionner ces ordres ?",,

nodes.bodyText:
typo : sur --> sure
Try not to abbreviate "manufacturing" into "manuf" or at least put a dot : "manuf."
Error messages should be defined in static variables in a separate interface.

concerns --> concern (no s), "and will" --> with
Error messages should be defined in static variables in a separate interface.
Error messages should be defined in static variables in a separate interface.
Is the case where no line is selected handled ? Either here or in the "merge" method, I don't see it when looking rapidly.
I know it's a detail, but proper practice is to end the tags with /> instead of > when there is no content.

nodes.bodyText: "planified" is... somewhat a valid word. But hardly ever used. Probably better to use "planned" instead.

nodes.bodyText: Fusionned ? Couldn't it me "merged" instead ? Fusionned hardly even exists. If really no better word can be found, write it with a single n : fusioned.

nodes.bodyText:
I cannot accept 700 lines of re-indentation.
There are probably things you actually changed in there, but I have no idea why and it also causes merge conflicts afterwards.
If the code needs to be adapted to a specific code standard, it should be done in a separate commit.
